001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
009
010import java.util.Optional;
011import java.util.regex.Matcher;
012import java.util.regex.Pattern;
013
014import javax.xml.XMLConstants;
015
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
017import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
018import nl.talsmasoftware.lazy4j.Lazy;
019
020/**
021 * A factory that produces qualified names.
022 * <p>
023 * This implementation uses an underlying integer-based cache to reduce the
024 * memory footprint of qualified names and namespaces by reusing instances with
025 * the same namespace and local name.
026 */
027public final class EQNameFactory {
028  private static final Pattern URI_QUALIFIED_NAME = Pattern.compile("^Q\\{([^{}]*)\\}(.+)$");
029  private static final Pattern LEXICAL_NAME = Pattern.compile("^(?:([^:]+):)?(.+)$");
030  @NonNull
031  private static final Lazy<EQNameFactory> INSTANCE = ObjectUtils.notNull(Lazy.lazy(EQNameFactory::new));
032
033  @NonNull
034  private final QNameCache cache;
035
036  /**
037   * Get the singleton instance.
038   *
039   * @return the singleton instance
040   */
041  @NonNull
042  public static EQNameFactory instance() {
043    return ObjectUtils.notNull(INSTANCE.get());
044  }
045
046  private EQNameFactory() {
047    // disable construction
048    this(QNameCache.instance());
049  }
050
051  private EQNameFactory(@NonNull QNameCache cache) {
052    this.cache = cache;
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Get an existing qualified name by looking up the cached entry using the
057   * provided index value.
058   *
059   * @param index
060   *          the index value to lookup
061   * @return an optional containing the qualified name, if it exists
062   */
063  @NonNull
064  public Optional<IEnhancedQName> get(int index) {
065    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Optional.ofNullable(cache.get(index)));
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Get a new qualified name based on the provided namespace and local name.
070   *
071   * @param namespace
072   *          the namespace part of the qualified name
073   * @param localName
074   *          the local part of the qualified name
075   *
076   * @return the qualified name
077   */
078  @NonNull
079  public IEnhancedQName newQName(@NonNull String namespace, @NonNull String localName) {
080    return cache.of(namespace, localName);
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Parse a name as a qualified name.
085   * <p>
086   * The name can be:
087   * <ul>
088   * <li>A URI qualified name of the form <code>Q{URI}name</code>, where the URI
089   * represents the namespace</li>
090   * <li>A lexical name of the forms <code>prefix:name</code> or
091   * <code>name</code>, where the prefix represents the namespace</li>
092   * </ul>
093   *
094   * @param name
095   *          the name to parse
096   * @param resolver
097   *          the prefix resolver to use to determine the namespace for a given
098   *          prefix
099   * @return the parsed qualified name
100   */
101  @NonNull
102  public IEnhancedQName parseName(
103      @NonNull String name,
104      @NonNull PrefixToNamespaceResolver resolver) {
105    Matcher matcher = URI_QUALIFIED_NAME.matcher(name);
106    return matcher.matches()
107        ? newUriQualifiedName(matcher)
108        : parseLexicalQName(name, resolver);
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Parse a URI qualified name.
113   * <p>
114   * The name is expected to be a URI qualified name of the form
115   * <code>{URI}name</code>, where the URI represents the namespace.
116   *
117   * @param name
118   *          the name to parse
119   * @return the parsed qualified name
120   */
121  @NonNull
122  public IEnhancedQName parseUriQualifiedName(@NonNull String name) {
123    Matcher matcher = URI_QUALIFIED_NAME.matcher(name);
124    if (!matcher.matches()) {
125      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
126          String.format("The name '%s' is not a valid BracedURILiteral of the form: Q{URI}local-name", name));
127    }
128    return newUriQualifiedName(matcher);
129  }
130
131  @NonNull
132  private IEnhancedQName newUriQualifiedName(@NonNull Matcher matcher) {
133    return cache.of(
134        ObjectUtils.notNull(matcher.group(1)),
135        ObjectUtils.notNull(matcher.group(2)));
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Parse a lexical name as a qualified name.
140   * <p>
141   * The name is expected to be a lexical name of the forms
142   * <code>prefix:name</code> or <code>name</code>, where the prefix represents
143   * the namespace.
144   *
145   * @param name
146   *          the name to parse
147   * @param resolver
148   *          the prefix resolver to use to determine the namespace for a given
149   *          prefix
150   * @return the parsed qualified name
151   */
152  @NonNull
153  public IEnhancedQName parseLexicalQName(
154      @NonNull String name,
155      @NonNull PrefixToNamespaceResolver resolver) {
156    Matcher matcher = LEXICAL_NAME.matcher(name);
157    if (!matcher.matches()) {
158      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
159          String.format("The name '%s' is not a valid lexical QName of the form: prefix:local-name or local-name",
160              name));
161    }
162    String prefix = matcher.group(1);
163
164    if (prefix == null) {
165      prefix = XMLConstants.DEFAULT_NS_PREFIX;
166    }
167
168    String namespace = resolver.resolve(prefix);
169    if (namespace == null) {
170      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
171          String.format("The prefix '%s' is not bound for name '%s'",
172              prefix,
173              name));
174    }
175    return cache.of(namespace, ObjectUtils.notNull(matcher.group(2)));
176  }
177
178  /**
179   * Provides a callback for resolving namespace prefixes.
180   */
181  @FunctionalInterface
182  public interface PrefixToNamespaceResolver {
183    /**
184     * Get the URI string for the provided namespace prefix.
185     *
186     * @param prefix
187     *          the namespace prefix
188     * @return the URI string or {@code null} if the prefix is unbound
189     */
190    @Nullable
191    String resolve(@NonNull String prefix);
192  }
193
194}
